page.title: 09PRONY HILL FARM:AUT/WINTER
page.content: The hill farm year begins at the end of Oct. The farmer ensures that his ewes are in good health so that many lams will be born.A weak ewe is called and eilde.The sheep are dosed with an anthilmintic, which kills worms found in grass.Some shepherds say that a sheep is really a worm in sheeps clothing! The sheep are then put onto fresh pasture. At the start of Nov the rams are mated with the ewes.The rest of Nov and Dec the sheep fend for them selves and are fed only in bad weather At the turn of the year the sheep are dipped to kill lice and keds,parasites which feed on flesh. Afterwards the sheep are fed on low ground and then go to the hill each day.Sheep lick high energy food blocks which are put on the hill.In wintry weather the farmer must clear snow to take feed to the sheep and dig them from snowdrifts
